source.citation: Moshenko, D.W. 1991. Evaluation of a Denis D3000 Telescopic Log Processor. FERIC Technical Note TN-166.
notes: Processor: Denis D3000 telescopic boom (Fletcher Challenge Canada, southern interior BC, 1990 study).
Detailed timing split yarder-decked vs. right-of-way stems; shift-level study mixes both feedstocks (8 h shifts, 5x per week).

Cycle elements averaged 0.67 min/stem (0.22 pick, 0.18 process, 0.12 optional second process, 0.15 discharge) with <10 min delays accounting for 3.9% of time and 92% of length measurements within ±7.5 cm.

scenarios.name: grapple_yarded
scenarios.description: Roadside processing of grapple-yarded decks (Block yarder decks).
notes: Detailed timing includes delays <10 min; assume same utilisation (81.7%) as shift-level comparisons when converting to SMH.
Deck prep included turning stems and breaking down piles when yarder orientation was inconsistent.

scenarios.name: right_of_way
scenarios.description: Processing hand-felled right-of-way wood (no yarding stage).
notes: Lower productivity reflects added time to sort/deck along the road; no yarding cost incurred for this wood.
Use when the processor is handling right-of-way stems or other mixed-sort roadside piles rather than clean grapple decks.

scenarios.name: mixed_shift
scenarios.description: Shift-level average combining yarded and right-of-way feedstocks (38 monitored shifts).
notes: Totals: 14,232 stems, 8,728 m³ over 297.6 TMH (PMH 243.0) with utilisation 81.7% and availability 92.2% across 38 productive shifts.
Use when mix of feedstocks or additional organizational delays (moves between ROW/yarded decks) mirror the study conditions.

cycle_time_minutes.process_optional_condition: applied when a second process pass was required (0.23 min when it occurred)
